main event: A UFO observation was recorded in Waterville, Minnesota on July 12, 1954 as part of Project 10073. The observation involved both ground-radar and air-visual sightings of a low altitude 1.2 inch in diameter object, possibly a balloon, moving from NW to SE at 12,000 ft altitude.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 3 minutes and was reported by a civilian source.
There were no photographs of the UFO included in the report.
The UFO was described as appearing round, orange in color, and swiftly moving, leaving no trail or sound.
The observers reported very high clouds and provided details of winds aloft during the observation.
There were no additional comments, and the location of the observer was 52 degrees 14 minutes north in Waterville, Minn.
sighted object: low altitude 1.2 inch in diameter object, possibly a balloon
